basic.description:
An intermediate laboratory course on the Physiology and Pharmacology of Neuroscience and Gastrointestinal function. Students develop skills to acquire and evaluate data and methods. Critical thinking skills are used for the development of arguments, assumptions, and information required to evaluate concepts and hypotheses.
NOTE    Priority will be given to students registered in a LISC Specialization Plan.
basic.subject: LISC
basic.title: Integrated Life Science Laboratory I

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite of PHGY214 and a corequisite of PHAR340
